quanteda

recompile a hashed tokens object

This function recompiles a hashed tokens object when the vocabulary has been changed in a way that makes some of its types identical, such as lowercasing when a lowercased version of the type already exists in the hash table, or introduces gaps in the integer map of the types. It also reindexes the types atttribute to account for types that may have become duplicates, through a procedure such as stemming or lowercasing; or the addition of new tokens through compounding.

tokens_hashed_recompile(x, method = c("C++", "R"))

Arguments

x
the tokens object to be recompiled
method
"C++" for C++ implementation or "R" for an older R-based method

Examples

# lowercasing
toks1 <- tokens(c(one = "a b c d A B C D",
                 two = "A B C d"))
attr(toks1, "types") <- char_tolower(attr(toks1, "types"))
unclass(toks1)
#> $one
#> [1] 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8
#> 
#> $two
#> [1] 5 6 7 4
#> 
#> attr(,"types")
#> [1] "a" "b" "c" "d" "a" "b" "c" "d"
#> attr(,"what")
#> [1] "word"
#> attr(,"ngrams")
#> [1] 1
#> attr(,"concatenator")
#> [1] ""
#> attr(,"padding")
#> [1] FALSE
unclass(quanteda:::tokens_hashed_recompile(toks1))
#> $one
#> [1] 1 2 3 4 1 2 3 4
#> 
#> $two
#> [1] 1 2 3 4
#> 
#> attr(,"types")
#> [1] "a" "b" "c" "d"
#> attr(,"what")
#> [1] "word"
#> attr(,"ngrams")
#> [1] 1
#> attr(,"concatenator")
#> [1] ""
#> attr(,"padding")
#> [1] FALSE

# stemming
toks2 <- tokens("Stemming stemmed many word stems.")
unclass(toks2)
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4 5 6
#> 
#> attr(,"types")
#> [1] "Stemming" "stemmed"  "many"     "word"     "stems"    "."       
#> attr(,"what")
#> [1] "word"
#> attr(,"ngrams")
#> [1] 1
#> attr(,"concatenator")
#> [1] ""
#> attr(,"padding")
#> [1] FALSE
unclass(quanteda:::tokens_hashed_recompile(tokens_wordstem(toks2)))
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4 2 5
#> 
#> attr(,"types")
#> [1] "Stem" "stem" "mani" "word" "."   
#> attr(,"what")
#> [1] "word"
#> attr(,"ngrams")
#> [1] 1
#> attr(,"concatenator")
#> [1] ""
#> attr(,"padding")
#> [1] FALSE

# compounding
toks3 <- tokens("One two three four.")
unclass(toks3)
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4 5
#> 
#> attr(,"types")
#> [1] "One"   "two"   "three" "four"  "."    
#> attr(,"what")
#> [1] "word"
#> attr(,"ngrams")
#> [1] 1
#> attr(,"concatenator")
#> [1] ""
#> attr(,"padding")
#> [1] FALSE
unclass(tokens_compound(toks3, "two three"))
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 1 4 2 3
#> 
#> attr(,"types")
#> [1] "One"       "four"      "."         "two_three"
#> attr(,"what")
#> [1] "word"
#> attr(,"ngrams")
#> [1] 1
#> attr(,"concatenator")
#> [1] "_"
#> attr(,"padding")
#> [1] FALSE

# lookup
dict <- dictionary(list(test = c("one", "three")))
unclass(tokens_lookup(toks3, dict))
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 1 1
#> 
#> attr(,"types")
#> [1] "test"
#> attr(,"what")
#> [1] "dictionary"
#> attr(,"ngrams")
#> [1] 1
#> attr(,"concatenator")
#> [1] ""
#> attr(,"padding")
#> [1] FALSE
#> attr(,"dictionary")
#> attr(,"dictionary")$test
#> [1] "one"   "three"
#> 

# empty pads
unclass(tokens_select(toks3, dict))
#> [[1]]
#> integer(0)
#> 
#> attr(,"types")
#> character(0)
#> attr(,"what")
#> [1] "word"
#> attr(,"ngrams")
#> [1] 1
#> attr(,"concatenator")
#> [1] ""
#> attr(,"padding")
#> [1] FALSE
unclass(tokens_select(toks3, dict, pad = TRUE))
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 0 0 0 0 0
#> 
#> attr(,"types")
#> character(0)
#> attr(,"what")
#> [1] "word"
#> attr(,"ngrams")
#> [1] 1
#> attr(,"concatenator")
#> [1] ""
#> attr(,"padding")
#> [1] TRUE

# ngrams
unclass(tokens_ngrams(toks3, n = 2:3))
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 1 2 3 4 5 6 7
#> 
#> attr(,"types")
#> [1] "One_two"        "two_three"      "three_four"     "four_."        
#> [5] "One_two_three"  "two_three_four" "three_four_."  
#> attr(,"what")
#> [1] "word"
#> attr(,"ngrams")
#> [1] 2 3
#> attr(,"concatenator")
#> [1] "_"
#> attr(,"padding")
#> [1] FALSE
#> attr(,"skip")
#> [1] 0
